medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with marked short stature at 28 years old. He was initially diagnosed with achondroplasia at 3 months but was later found to have acromesomelic dysplasia at 28 years. His limbs showed marked shortening in the middle and distal segments.
medical_history.past_medical_history: He had a previous diagnosis of abdominal aortic pseudoaneurysm at age 27, treated surgically with a stent graft and recurrence leading to a covered stent.
medical_history.family_history: Parents were first cousins with relatively short stature (father 155 cm, mother 153 cm). A stillborn elder brother due to nuchal cord and a healthy elder sister.
